verses.roman:
āmi kahi,--āmāra anātha pitā-mātā
āmi bālaka,--sannyāsera kibā jāni kathā

synonyms: āmi kahi—I said; āmāra—My; anātha—helpless; pitā-mātā—father and mother; āmi—I am; bālaka—only a child; sannyāsera—of the renounced order of life; kibā—what; jāni—I know; kathā—words.
translation: "I replied to Viśvarūpa, 'I have My helpless father and mother, and also I am but a child. What do I know about the sannyāsa order of life?
